content.title: Chief Minister’s Paryatan Vikas Yojana
content.department: Department of Tourism, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh
content.details: The scheme 'Chief Minister’s Paryatan Vikas Yojna (CMPVY)' was launched by the Government of Arunachal Pradesh to develop tourism facilities in the state to attract more tourism. The scheme has three components – a) Development support to Patisserie and Food courts, b) Development support for Homestays, c) Development of adventure sports by financial support in the procurement of equipment.
benefits: Direct loan subsidy of ₹5.00 lakh is provided to open Patisserie.
Support for Homestays and procurement of equipment for adventure tourism.
eligibility: Any Arunachal Pradesh domicile can apply to avail of the benefit of this scheme.
For Homestays: Beneficiaries should be registered with the Department of Tourism.
Those Homestay operators trained with the Department of Tourism will be given priority.
For Cab Service Operators and Patisseries, Food courts: Beneficiaries should be registered as tour operators with the Department of Tourism.
content.application_process: Offline. Applicants need to visit the nearest District Tourism Office, receive the application form, fill it out, attach relevant documents, and submit it for verification.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter ID card, etc.
Bank Account number/ front page of the passbook
Registration certificate with the Department of Tourism.
Training certificates of Dept. of Tourism (if applicable)
Registration certificate as a tour operator with the dept. of Tourism (for Cab Service Operators and Patisseries, Food courts)
Any other document, as requested by the Department of Tourism.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to promote tourism in the State and thereby livelihood for the locals.

faqs.question: By which department was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: Department of Tourism, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: What are the three components of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The three components of the scheme are – a) development support to Patisserie and Food courts, b) development support to Homestays, and c) development of adventure sports by financial support in the procurement of equipment.

faqs.question: How will this scheme help the Home Stay Operators?
faqs.answer: This scheme helps the Home Stay Operators through the renovation of 2 adequately sized well-furnished rooms with attached toilets with showers, geysers, and western toilets.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for the purchase of equipment under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is the provision for the purchase of various types of adventure tourism equipment such as rafts, kayaks, Quad bikes, lobs, lip lines, Bungee jumps, etc.

faqs.question: How much loan subsidy will be provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: A direct loan subsidy of ₹5.00 lakh is provided to open Patisserie.

faqs.question: Is registration mandatory for a beneficiary with the Dept. of Tourism?
faqs.answer: Yes, beneficiaries should be registered with the Dept. of Tourism.

faqs.question: Will anyone get priority under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, those Homestay operators who have trained with the Dept. of Tourism will be given priority.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Any Arunachal domicile can apply to avail of the benefit of this scheme.
